article: On a cold winter day, I waited in line to see my hero, Jack Canfield, the author of The Success Principles, who was going to deliver a speech on his new book.During his talk, Jack _ his wallet, pulled out a hundred-dollar bill, and said, Who wants this? _ shot up in the audience; people leaned forward to see whom Jack would _ . But I jumped up, ran up the _ to the stage, and grabbed the bill. As I was launching myself in the air, _ raced through my mind was I about to be humiliated in front of 800 people? Would they _ security guards and take me from the stage? _ my desire for bold action was louder than any _ voice. As I got the bill from his hand, he said, That s it! We can t wait for the _ to come to us. We must take _ to create what we want! After his talk, I _ to formally meet Jack and boldly asked for his personal e-mail address. Over the next months, I sent him emails _ my points of view and dreams with him. He kindly e-mailed back lots of encouragement. But my life got busy _ other things. I stopped e-mailing Jack.A year later, my dreams had worn away. I thought Jack would inspire me into action, like a giant arrow that would show me the way.I e-mailed him, and then again but got no _ . As I sat down at my computer to _ my e-mails, I _ woke up. What was I doing? I was waiting! Now I remembered the crowd, most likely _ that hundred-dollar bill, while they sat glued to their chairs.Usually we all have a Jack for whom we wait whether it s a person, a place or a thing. We _ believe the gifts of life are just around the corner, and that everything will come in a(n) _ way. So we don t try. We _ . But as Wayne Gretzky said You ll always miss 100% of the opportunities you don t take! So I stopped waiting and started my writing career.Now what are you waiting for?
